Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a grey-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the interior is spotted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a brown-coloured slip and faint traces of six lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing part of a letter.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.104)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87617) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87617)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 119 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
